intro: Heliomeris longifolia var. annua, commonly known as the annual heliomeris, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton, and is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows from seeds and thrives in well-drained soils, often in disturbed or open habitats.
